I couldn't agree with you more Andres. Congradulations to eBay's marketing
=
team! There is this perception out there that if it's on eBay, it must be
c=
heap!=A0 Amazon in general has THE best prices out there!
=A0
Mark
=A0

[Ma=
rk Jaillet]=A0=A0-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.=
com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Andres Pedraza
Sent: =
Monday, February 13, 2006 3:14 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com; nihonto=
@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Books on eBay



Does anybody unde=
rstand why people buy books on eBay for prices way
above what Amazon, for e=
xample, is charging? I see this all too
often. Do people not check other on=
line sources before bidding?

Amazon ($29.70 w/free shipping): HYPERLINK
"h=
ttp://tinyurl.com/8hkax"http://tinyurl.com/8hkax

eBay (bidding starts at $=
41.99 + shipping): HYPERLINK
"http://tinyurl.com/dqaeo"http://tinyurl.com/d=
qaeo

Or am I missing something here? I can understand when we're talking
a=
bout out-of-print/hard-to-find volumes, but books currently
available? And =
the book is a good reference, too. It's in my library
already. It just seem=
s to me that we already spend enough money on
our hobby as it is, without w=
asting our hard earned cash needlessly.

And that was my gripe of the day. =
Thanks for listening.

Dewa,

Andres
